result.value: Versatile simulator for structural variance and Nanopore/PacBio sequencing reads

This is an example of a configuration file. To make the simulation work, your configuration file has to have the exact same structure. (Make sure there is always a space after the equals sign and every parameter is captured in one single line) Structural variation: ----------------------------- VCF input = A list of SV positions can be given as input, look at the wiki section for the format of the VCF input. This option can be combined with random SV inputs Foreign sequences = If foreign sequences have to be inserted in the reference, they need to listed in a fasta file Tandem duplications = Tandem duplications count (Default: 0) Length (bp) = The range for the length of a single duplication (Default: 50-10000) Copies = The range of how many times the duplicated sequences is repeated (Default: 1-20) Heterozygosity = The percentage of heterozygous SVs (Default: 60%) Read simulation: ----------------------------- Sequencing depth = The genome coverage of the long reads (Default: 0). Besides a fixed value, the path to a sequencing depth profile obtained with samtools can be given. Median length = The average length of the reads (Default: 25000) Length range = The range for the lengths of the reads, it will give a normal distribution around the median length (Default: 500-150000) Accuracy = The average accuracy of the reads (Default: 88%) Error profile = This is a file that contains the error profile of the sequencing technology, the github page provides ONT, PacBio RS2, Sequel II & Sequel CCS/HiFi. These error profiles will provide the ratios, which will kept when adjusting the average accuracy to your liking
Sim-it: A structural variance and Nanopore/PacBio sequencing reads simulator
**!A more complete manual can found under the wiki section!** https://github.com/ndierckx/Sim-it/wiki perl Sim-it1.3.3.pl -c config_Sim-it.txt -o output/directory/path

Project:
-----------------------------
Project name             = Test
Reference sequence       = /path/to/reference.fasta
Replace ambiguous nts(N) = 
Max threads              = 8 
Project:
-----------------------------
Project name             = Choose a name for your project, it will be used for the output files.
Reference sequence       = /path/to/reference.fasta  #it can be a gzipped file
Replace ambiguous nts(N) = If the reference contains regions with ambiguous nucleotides, these can be replaced by 
                           random nucleotides to avoid reads consisting out of Ns (yes/no) (Default: no)
Max threads              = You can choose the mamximum parallel threads that can be used (Default: no)

**1. Example of configuration file:** 
 

Long Read simulation:
-----------------------------
Sequencing depth         = 0
Median length            = 25000
Length range             = 500-150000
Accuracy                 = 94%
Error profile            = error_profile_ONT.txt

result.description:
- Amount of threads can be selected in the new config file
- Accuracy input can now accept decimal values
- Resolved a little bug in 1.3.3
result.name: Sim-it1.3.4

result.description: * Version 1.3.1 should not be used, a line was accidentally deleted, which caused incorrect simulations.
result.name: Sim-it1.3.2

parent_header: Sim-it: A structural variance and Nanopore/PacBio sequencing reads simulator
result.value: Perl From version 1.3.2 on, additional Perl modules need to be installed: cpan Parallel::ForkManager
